page.title: 17CLUBS
page.content: The clubs and committees of Skelton & District form the backbone of social activity and they are many and varied considering the small population. The Village Hall and its committee are fundamental to many activities as the premises are used by many organis- ations. The building is available for private hire. The re-formed Bowls Club (1982) use the Green behind the Hall and the Playgroup, Youth Club, Women's Institute and Over 60's meet in the Hall. Other groups are connected with the School and include the Young Orni -thologist's Club, the Parent Teacher Association and the Village Swimming Club. The Young Farmer's Club and the Agricultural & Horticultural Society are prominent the latter promoting the major village show in Cumbria.
